description: From Old French verifier (French: vérifier), from Medieval Latin vērificāre, present active infinitive of vērificō (“make true”), from Latin vērus (“true”) + faciō (“do, make”); see -fy.

verbs.description: verify (third-person singular simple present verifies, present participle verifying, simple past and past participle verified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To substantiate or prove the truth of something.
(transitive) To confirm or test the truth or accuracy of something.
examples: In comparison, it takes about a minute to save, rewind and manually verify a similar file on a cassette.

entries.meaning: (transitive, law) To affirm something formally, under oath.
